title: Robbery in Louvre: How thieves made off with Napolean-era jewels in daring 7-min heist
content: A daring seven-minute heist at Paris's Louvre Museum saw thieves on scooters, armed with chainsaws, storm the Apollo Gallery. They made off with Napoleon and Empress's priceless jewellery collection, entering via a basket lift. One damaged piece was later found. This audacious daylight robbery, confirmed by France's interior minister, has led to the museum's closure and a full investigation.

title: 'An illegal drug leader': Trump lashes out at Columbia's prez; halts US aid to the country
content: President Donald Trump announced the U.S. will cut all aid to Colombia, accusing President Gustavo Petro of enabling massive drug production. Trump's declaration on Truth Social comes amid escalating tensions over U.S. military strikes in Caribbean waters targeting suspected drug traffickers, which Petro has sharply criticized.

title: 'They called Lord Ram a myth': CM Yogi slams Congress, SP at Ayodhya Deepotsav
content: Uttar Pradesh chief minister Yogi Adityanath launched a strong attack on the Congress and Samajwadi Party at Deepotsav-2025, accusing them of insulting India's faith and obstructing the Ram Janmabhoomi movement. He highlighted their alleged past actions, including calling Lord Ram a myth and firing at devotees, contrasting them with the current celebration of truth and faith in Ayodhya.

title: Gill blames top-order collapse after loss: 'When you lose 3 wickets in powerplay'
content: India's captain Shubman Gill acknowledged the difficulty of losing three wickets in the powerplay after their seven-wicket loss to Australia in the first ODI. Despite the early setbacks, Gill was satisfied with how the team took the game deep while defending their total. He also expressed gratitude for the fans' unwavering support throughout the tour.

title: Massive shake-up at ScaleAI: Zuckerberg-backed firm lays off entire team; then invites employees to..
content: Scale AI has disbanded its Dallas-based New Projects Organization, a team of contractors focused on general AI chatbot improvement. This move, following a significant Meta investment, signals an industry pivot towards specialized, expert-level AI training in fields like medicine and robotics.  Affected workers received severance and were offered opportunities on Scale's gig platform.

title: Happy Diwali 2025: Best 50 messages, quotes, wishes, and images to share
content: Diwali 2025, on October 20th, promises a vibrant celebration of light, prosperity, and new beginnings. As families prepare for festivities, the article emphasizes the importance of sharing heartfelt messages and wishes to strengthen bonds. It offers a curated collection of greetings and practical tips to ensure your Diwali messages resonate deeply, spreading joy and connection across distances.

title: Bihar polls: 5 tips Cong can take from BJP‚Äôs pre-poll playbook - from cadre to alliance
content: As Bihar heads for assembly polls, the Congress and its allies grapple with seat-sharing disputes and mixed messaging, contrasting sharply with the BJP's methodical campaign. The BJP's strengths in ground cadre, alliance discipline, unified leadership, data-driven candidate selection, and forward-looking campaigning offer crucial lessons for the Congress's revival.

title: Upset Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang says: Our market share has fallen to Zero from 95% in ...
content: Nvidia's advanced AI chip dominance in China has evaporated, dropping to zero due to US export controls. CEO Jensen Huang revealed the company is completely barred from selling high-performance chips, warning this exclusion harms both nations and cedes the market to domestic rivals like Huawei.  China's push for self-sufficiency accelerates this shift.

title: Gaza truce falters: Hamas attacks Israeli troops in Rafah; IDF launches airstrikes
content: Two Israeli soldiers were injured in Tubas, West Bank, on Saturday evening when Palestinian fighters threw an explosive device at them during an IDF operation. The assailant escaped, and the soldiers were hospitalised. In response, the IDF reinforced its presence in Tubas and blocked town entrances.

title: RJD-Cong stalemate in Bihar, setback in J'khand - is this end of road for INDIA bloc?
content: The INDIA bloc faces significant challenges as its founding unity unravels. Nitish Kumar's departure from the alliance and ongoing seat-sharing disputes in Bihar, coupled with JMM's independent stance in Jharkhand, highlight deep-seated friction. Recent setbacks in Maharashtra, Haryana, and Delhi further expose the bloc's struggle for cohesion and a unified leadership.

title: 1st ODI: Why Australia had to chase 131 despite India scoring 136/9
content: Australia secured a seven-wicket victory over India in a rain-shortened Perth ODI. India posted 136/9 in 26 overs. Australia, set a revised target of 131, reached it with nearly five overs to spare. Mitch Marsh led the chase with an unbeaten 46. This loss ends India's eight-match ODI winning streak in 2025.

title: Bill Gates warns: We're closer polio eradication; Microsoft founder says risks remain
content: Microsoft co-founder Bill Gates issues a grave health warning, highlighting that polio eradication remains elusive despite significant progress. He stresses that a critical funding shortfall threatens decades of global health gains, as viruses exploit immunity gaps.  Gates urges renewed commitments from world leaders to close these deadly gaps, emphasizing that no place is risk-free until the world is polio-free.

title: Robbery in Louvre: World-famous museum in France evacuated, shuts down - what was stolen
content: Thieves on scooters, armed with chainsaws, executed a daring daylight heist at the Louvre, making off with priceless jewels from Napoleon's collection. The world-famous museum was forced to shut down as authorities launched an intensive investigation into the brazen break-in, which targeted the Apollo Gallery. This incident adds another chapter to the Louvre's storied and sometimes notorious, history of art and artifact thefts.

title: Bihar polls: For INDIA, its ally vs ally; will bloc be able to decide CM face?
content: INDIA bloc partners face a test of coherence as RJD pushes for Tejashwi Yadav as CM face, while Congress and CPI-ML remain non-committal. "Friendly fights" in several constituencies highlight the alliance's internal friction, raising concerns about presenting a united front ahead of nominations closing.

title: China helps Pak launch satellite: Third such mission this year
content: China successfully orbited a Pakistani remote sensing satellite, PRSS-2, alongside two of its own satellites on Sunday. This marks the third Pakistani satellite launch facilitated by China this year, highlighting robust space cooperation. Remote sensing satellites gather crucial Earth data, aiding in monitoring environmental and geographic shifts. This mission further strengthens Pakistan's space capabilities through Chinese assistance.

title: Travis Kelce defends Taylor Swift amid backlash over ‚Äòshowgirl‚Äô marketing
content: Taylor Swift's 38 album variants for 'The Life of a Showgirl' spark debate, with some calling her marketing 'exploitative' despite her business genius.  Limited editions create urgency, driving resale markets.  While Swift earns through music, critics question if she sells authenticity or aspiration from her 'gilded fortress,' prompting fans to consider their purchasing habits.

title: Ayesha Curry quietly shows love for Stephen Curry amid recent backlash
content: Despite recent fan backlash over her personal comments, Ayesha Curry showed unwavering support for husband Stephen Curry after a Warriors loss. She shared a team cheer and presented him with custom cakes, highlighting their enduring bond. The couple remains focused on their family amidst public scrutiny, with Ayesha's past podcast remarks continuing to fuel debate.

title: Carter Hart delivers strong message to Mitch Marner and the Golden Knights
content: Carter Hart is making an NHL comeback with the Vegas Golden Knights on a professional tryout contract. After a hiatus, the 27-year-old goaltender is eager to prove himself, having learned and grown from past experiences.  Vegas aims to bolster their goaltending with Hart, who will be eligible to play from December 1st, potentially debuting soon after.

title: 'No Kings' protests: Trump hits back with AI video of himself wearing crown, flying jet
content: President Donald Trump shared AI-generated videos and images on social media, depicting himself as a king and mocking "No Kings" protests. These demonstrations, organized against his "authoritarian agenda," saw millions participate nationwide. Trump's posts sparked debate, with some viewing them as humorous and others as ironic given the protest's message.

title: Gill joins Kohli in unwanted captaincy record after defeat to Australia
content: Shubman Gill's captaincy debut for India's ODIs ended in a seven-wicket loss to Australia in Perth. India's top order collapsed, setting a modest target of 136 after a rain-affected innings. Despite KL Rahul's efforts, Australia comfortably chased down the revised score, with Mitchell Marsh leading the charge. Gill acknowledged the learning curve for his new role.

title: Back in time for Diwali: AI to bring back stranded Milan flyers; 256 set to return Sunday
content: Air India has scheduled a special flight on Sunday, October 19th, to bring 256 Delhi-bound passengers home from Milan in time for Diwali. The original flight, AI 138, was cancelled on October 17th due to a technical issue with the Boeing 787 Dreamliner. The airline has provided accommodation and meals to the stranded passengers.

title: IND vs AUS: Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma flop; Australia take 1st ODI
content: Australia secured a seven-wicket victory over India in the first ODI. Rain reduced the match to 26 overs per side. India scored 136 for 9. Australia chased down the DLS-adjusted target of 131. Mitchell Marsh led the chase with an unbeaten 46. Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma's return was brief. The Indian pace attack struggled. Australia leads the series 1-0.

title: It's a boy! Parineeti Chopra and Raghav Chadha welcome their first child together
content: Bollywood star Parineeti Chopra and politician Raghav Chadha joyfully welcomed their first child on October 20, 2025. The couple, who announced their pregnancy in August, celebrated the arrival of their baby in Delhi. Their journey from a chance meeting in London to marriage and now parenthood has captivated fans nationwide.

title: Chris Evert vs Martina Navratilova net worth 2025: Who‚Äôs richer, career and endorsements
content: Tennis titans Chris Evert and Martina Navratilova continue to shine post-retirement. As of 2025, Navratilova boasts a higher net worth of $25 million, attributed to her extensive career, doubles dominance, and business ventures. Evert, with $16 million, remains a beloved figure, celebrated for her Grand Slam achievements and enduring legacy. Their legendary rivalry and enduring friendship continue to inspire.

title: World Junior C'ship: Tanvi loses in final; settles for silver
content: Indian shuttler Tanvi Sharma secured a silver medal at the BWF World Junior Championships. She lost to Thailand's Anyapat Phichitpreechasak in the women's singles final. Tanvi became the third Indian female shuttler to reach the tournament final. She secured India's first silver medal in 17 years. The match was competitive but Phichitpreechasak ultimately won the title.

title: IND vs AUS: Siraj turns superhero on boundary ropes - Watch
content: Mohammed Siraj's athletic one-handed catch on the boundary highlighted India's fielding efforts in a rain-affected ODI. Despite a modest 136/9 in 26 overs, led by KL Rahul's 38, India aims to defend their total against Australia.  The match, reduced by rain, saw early wickets for India before a late surge.

title: Bangkok: Indian origin man threatens public with gun-shaped lighter; arrested
content: An Indian national, Sahil Ram Thadani, was arrested in Bangkok after causing a public disturbance outside a hotel. He was seen loudly threatening people with a gun-shaped lighter. Police intervened and charged him with threatening behavior and public disturbance, suspecting cannabis-induced hallucinations.

title: Tarsem Jassar highlights Sikh history; says Diwali ‚Äòbelongs to everyone equally, beyond religion‚Äô - Exclusive
content: Punjabi star Tarsem Jassar views Diwali as a universal celebration of faith, freedom, and compassion, transcending religious boundaries. He highlights its significance in Sikh history as Bandi Chhor Diwas, symbolizing courage. For Jassar, the festival is a cherished family affair, marked by tradition, gratitude, and the simple joys of homemade sweets and togetherness.

title: 'Make a deal': Putin makes war-end offer to Trump; what does he want from Ukraine?
content: Russian President Vladimir Putin has demanded full control of Donetsk from Ukraine as a condition to end the war, according to The Washington Post. This demand was reportedly made during a call with US President Donald Trump. While Putin offered concessions in Zaporizhzhia and Kherson, European diplomats dismissed the proposal as insignificant.

title: China accuses US of cyberattack: Beijing says sensitive info stolen
content: China's ministry of state security accused the US NSA of conducting cyberattacks on its National Time Service Center, exploiting mobile messaging vulnerabilities to steal sensitive data. The ministry stated these attacks, using specialised tools, targeted critical timing systems and warned of potential disruptions to network communications, financial systems, and power supply.

title: End of an era: Calcutta Stock Exchange prepares for final Diwali
content: Kolkata's historic Calcutta Stock Exchange is preparing for a voluntary exit after a decade of legal battles, marking its last Kali Puja and Diwali as a working exchange. Trading was suspended in 2013. Shareholders approved the exit, and SEBI is now overseeing the valuation process.

title: Trump wants India to stop buying Russian oil ‚Äî but can it? Why crude imports can at best be reduced
content: Donald Trump claims India will cease Russian oil imports, a move PM Modi reportedly assured. However, India's significant reliance on discounted Russian crude, making up over a third of its supply, presents a complex challenge. Abruptly stopping these purchases is difficult due to existing contracts and economic advantages, potentially impacting global prices.

title: Six-year-old boy sets world record for identifying classical composers by ear
content: A six-year-old Dubai boy, Shivankh Varun Varadharajan, has achieved a Guinness World Record by identifying 16 classical composers in just 60 seconds. His extraordinary musical talent, evident since toddlerhood, allows him to perceive personalities and moods through music. Supported by his family, Shivankh's achievement showcases the power of early musical exposure and neurodivergent perspectives.

title: 'Israel armed criminal militias': Is Hamas planning attack on Gaza civilians?
content: Hamas has strongly denied United States claims of the terror group planning attacks against civilians in Gaza. The Palestinian militant group stated these allegations are false and part of Israeli propaganda. Hamas asserts its police forces are protecting residents and holding militias accountable. Meanwhile, Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu indicated the war will continue until Hamas is disarmed.

title: Muhurat Trading 2025: When NSE, BSE will open for special session? Date, time & more
content: India's stock markets are set for the symbolic Muhurat Trading session, marking the start of the new Hindu financial year, Samvat 2082. This one-hour special trading window, held on October 21, is observed for its auspicious beginnings and historical tendency for market gains, reflecting optimism for the year ahead.

title: TN weather: Heavy rains trigger landslides; train services on Nilgiri Mountain Railway cancelled
content: Due to relentless downpours, the Nilgiri Mountain Railway has halted operations as debris has obstructed the tracks. Compounding this issue, an emerging low-pressure system in the Bay of Bengal is forecasted to strengthen, leading to fishing advisories being issued along Tamil Nadu's shores.

title: Watch: Vande Bharat pantry staff fight with dustbins, belts in Delhi
content: A heated argument between pantry assistants on the Khajuraho Vande Bharat Express at Hazrat Nizamuddin station escalated into a physical scuffle, captured in a viral video. Police have registered a case, and four employees were taken into custody. Their identity cards were deactivated, and the service provider faces contract termination and a hefty fine.

title: Green ‚Äòbachchon ka‚Äô, banned crackers ‚Äòbadon ka‚Äô; buyers snap up illegal stock in Delhi-NCR
content: Despite the legal sale of green firecrackers commencing, conventional, polluting varieties were freely available across Delhi-NCR markets, flouting Supreme Court orders. Sellers employed code words and hid banned items, while fake QR codes adorned many products. Authorities deployed inspection teams, but illegal sales persisted, impacting licensed traders.

title: '25,000 Americans would've died': Video shows moment US struck 'drug-carrying' submarine - Watch
content: US forces destroyed a large drug-carrying submarine en route to the United States, preventing an estimated 25,000 potential overdose deaths. Two suspected traffickers were returned to Ecuador and Colombia for prosecution, while two others were killed in the strike. This action is part of a broader campaign against drug trafficking from Latin America.

title: Inside Vance‚Äôs Marine past: From an Iraq recruit to flexing military power in California
content: Vice President JD Vance marked the US semiquincentennial with a powerful military demonstration at Camp Pendleton, showcasing Marine strength amid a government shutdown. The event, which drew protesters and criticism from Governor Newsom, highlighted Vance's return to his military roots and his use of military symbolism to project federal resolve and appeal to voters.

title: 'Tech issue': Air India Milan‚ÄìDelhi flight cancelled after snag; 250 passengers stranded
content: Hundreds of Diwali travelers faced disruptions as an Air India Dreamliner's technical snag at Milan airport led to the cancellation of flight AI138 to Delhi on Friday. Most of the 250 passengers have been rebooked for October 20, coinciding with the festival, with the airline providing hotel accommodations and ground assistance.

title: Travis Kelce's status vs Raiders: Injury update ahead of today's game
content: Kansas City Chiefs tight end Travis Kelce is expected to play against the Las Vegas Raiders in Week 7. Despite lingering ankle soreness, Kelce leads the team in receiving yards and has a history of dominating the Raiders. A betting model predicts he will exceed receiving yard and reception props, highlighting his continued impact.

title: ‚ÄòNo Kings‚Äô protests sweep US: Why are millions marching against Trump?
content: Millions across the US participated in "No Kings" protests, advocating for democracy and opposing perceived authoritarian tendencies. Demonstrators emphasized citizenship, free speech, and civic responsibility, connecting current actions to a legacy of grassroots activism. The movement highlights widespread public concern over the nation's direction and the protection of democratic principles.

title: Dragon-like millipede discovered in Thailand‚Äôs Pha Daeng cave
content: Scientists exploring northern Thailand's Pha Daeng Cave have discovered a new millipede species, Desmoxytes chaofa, or the Princess Dragon Millipede. This tiny, dragon-like creature, distinguished by its spiky body and delicate legs, was found in the cave's unique karst ecosystem. The discovery highlights the importance of protecting hidden cave environments and their undiscovered biodiversity.

title: Durant, Rockets agree to 2-year, $90M extension
content: Rockets star Kevin Durant has agreed to a two-year, $90 million contract extension, taking about $30 million less than a potential maximum deal.

title: Dabo touts 'credibility' after Clemson's latest loss
content: Clemson coach Dabo Swinney said there is "no quit" in his team and touted his "credibility" after 18 years at the school as the Tigers fell to 3-4.

title: Penn State loses interim's debut, 0-4 in Big Ten
content: Penn State fell to 3-4 -- and 0-4 in the Big Ten -- after blowing a late lead against Iowa in interim coach Terry Smith's first game since replacing James Franklin.

title: D-III RB romps to NCAA record with 522 yards
content: Curry College running back Montie Quinn took down the NCAA record for all divisions by rushing for 522 yards on 20 carries while tacking on seven touchdowns in a 71-27 win over Nichols.

title: Sources: Vols' Vitello favorite to land Giants job
content: The Giants have zeroed in on University of Tennessee baseball coach Tony Vitello for their managerial opening, sources confirmed to ESPN.

title: Sources: Panthers eye other teams' 2-RB attack
content: The Panthers, who now feature both Chuba Hubbard and Rico Dowdle, have studied and inquired how other teams with productive running back tandems have juggled the workload between two backs, sources told ESPN.

title: Miami, CFP mulling plans for Hard Rock conflict
content: The University of Miami and the College Football Playoff are working on a contingency plan to account for a possible Hard Rock Stadium scheduling conflict if the Hurricanes make the playoff and earn a first-round home game.

title: Titans to simplify offense for Ward, sources say
content: The Titans are expected to simplify their offense for No. 1 overall pick Cam Ward, league sources told ESPN.

title: üèÄ 2025-26 BPI predictions for 23 NBA teams
content: The code is written. The simulations run. Here's who BPI projects to be in the top six in each conference, those fighting for play-in spots and three teams with high-variance young prospects.

content: Updated inactives and analysis based on the latest reports and official announcements leading up to kickoff.

content: Should we expect a big day for the Bucs' receiving core? Can Quinshon Judkins go over 100 yards? And which AFC game could be low-scoring?

title: Our guide to every game: Matchup previews, predictions, picks and nuggets
content: Offense showdown in Bucs-Lions? Who wins Jayden Daniels vs. Dak Prescott? We have picks and predictions.

title: Keys to ALCS Game 6 (and maybe 7): Superstar dilemmas, secret heroes and numbers to watch
content: The series shifts to Toronto with Seattle a win from the World Series. Here's what the Blue Jays and Mariners must do from here.

title: Pavia's pose, Brohm's big win: Week 8's CFB superlatives
content: We awarded nontraditional superlatives to programs, players and performances from across Week 8 of the 2025 college football season.

title: Week 7 betting guide: Saquon comes to life, Bo Nix continues to run and a pair of teasers to play
content: Our experts dive into the lines and player props that offer value for Week 7 and share their tips and bets.

title: Jalen Hurts' passing game has fallen short of what the Eagles need
content: It's never a good idea to bet against the QB, but it's fair to say he hasn't gotten there yet this season.

title: 'He was a different dude': Looking back at Jim Harbaugh's career-best season with the 1995 Colts
content: This year marks the 30th anniversary of the 1995 Colts' magical run and Jim Harbaugh's best season as a quarterback.

title: Man City's Haaland shows why he's the best striker in the game right now
content: Saturday's win demonstrated what an elite striker can do for your team as Erling Haaland's goals lifted Man City to a comfy win. With such a dominate scorer in your team, there's always a chance.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Messi close to signing new Inter Miami contract
content: Lionel Messi is close to signing a new contract with Inter Miami after winning the MLS Golden Boot. Transfer Talk has the latest news and rumors.

title: Ohtani's Game 4 reminds us of the improbability of his greatness
content: A 469-foot blast, a series-clinching gem on the same night? We got the full Ohtani October experience.

title: Offseason questions for eliminated teams: What's next for Brewers after NLCS defeat
content: Here's how the winter looks in Milwaukee -- and in the other towns whose teams lost their final postseason game.

title: The NHL's small-sample shock teams: Who has under- and overperformed?
content: We explore what has happened (good or bad) for seven particular teams -- and predict whether it'll continue.

title: 9 Days In, Gaza Truce Cracks As Israel, Hamas Trade Accusations
content: Gaza's nine-day-old ceasefire came under strain Sunday after the Israeli army said it launched air strikes in the territory's south in response to attacks it claimed were carried out by Hamas against its forces.

title: Amid RSS March Row, BJP Vs Congress On Siddaramaiah's 'Sanatani' Warning
content: Karnataka Chief Minister Siddaramaiah has sparked a row with his comments on "Sanatan" that incorporated a warning -- stay away from the right wing and remain cautious about the Rashtriya Swayamsevak Sangh or RSS, the BJP's ideological mentor.

title: In Xi Jinping's Message To Taiwan Opposition Leader, A "Reunification" Call
content: Chinese President Xi Jinping called on Sunday for efforts to advance "reunification" in a message of congratulations to the new leader of Taiwan's main opposition party, whose election took place amid accusations of interference by Beijing.

title: Air India To Run Special Flight For Fliers Stranded In Milan Ahead Of Diwali
content: Air India will operate a special flight from Milan to Delhi on Sunday to bring back passengers stranded in the Italian city after the airline had cancelled their flight on Friday following a technical issue with the Dreamliner aircraft.

title: One Jewellery Piece Stolen From Louvre Found Near Museum
content: France's Culture Minister Rachida Dati said one of the jewellery pieces stolen on Sunday from the Louvre in Paris had been found near the museum.

title: Opposition Announces Mega Protest In Mumbai Over 'Irregularities' In Poll Rolls
content: The Opposition in Maharashtra has announced a massive protest against the Election Commission of India (EC), accusing it of irregularities in the voters' list and a lack of transparency in the electoral process.

title: Napoleonic Jewels Stolen From Louvre In Paris In Daring Sunday Heist
content: The Louvre has closed for the day after a French minister reported a robbery at the iconic museum in Paris that is home to some of the world's most iconic historical artefacts, including the Mona Lisa.

title: Israel Strikes Rafah After Forces Targeted By "Terrorists", Says Military
content: The Israeli military confirmed it carried out air strikes in the southern Gaza city of Rafah on Sunday after its troops came under fire from militants.

title: How Social Distancing Led Merritt Moore To Find Dance Partners In Robots
content: During the COVID-19 pandemic, quantum physicist and professional ballerina Merritt Moore found a unique way to keep her passion alive: by dancing with robots.

title: Tourist Asked Cop Why Louvre Was Shut, Was Told To "Watch The News"
content: The world-famous Louvre Museum in Paris was unexpectedly shut on Sunday following a robbery. Confused tourists gathered outside, wondering what must have been the case.

title: An Extramarital Affair, Pregnancy, Then Double Murder In Delhi
content: A dispute over an extramarital affair has left two people dead in central Delhi. In the horrifying incident, a pregnant woman was stabbed to death by her lover in public view in the Ram Nagar area, while her husband managed to kill him.

title: The Louvre To Grunes Gewolbe: Biggest Museum Heists In History
content: Precious jewels from the Napoleon era were stolen from the renowned Louvre Museum in Paris this morning.

title: Prince Andrew Asked Police To Dig Up Dirt On Sexual Abuse Accuser: Report
content: Britain's Prince Andrew asked police in 2011 to dig up personal information about Virginia Giuffre, the woman who accused him of sexually abusing her as a teenager, a British newspaper reported on Sunday, days after the royal gave up his Duke of York

title: Restaurant Owner Shot For Serving Non-Veg Biryani To Vegetarian Customer
content: A 47-year-old hotel owner in Ranchi was shot dead after a vegetarian customer was allegedly served non-veg biryani, police said on Sunday.

title: In And Out In 7 Minutes, With Disc Cutters: How Louvre Robbery Was Carried Out
content: Men wielding disc cutters rode up to the heavily guarded Louvre Museum in Paris on a scooter, stole priceless jewellery and left in seven minutes - less time than it takes to finish a portion of French fries.

title: "Forgotten Their Roots": DK Shivakumar On Kiran Majumdar-Shaw's Criticisms
content: There seems to be no end in sight to the online standoff between Karnataka Deputy Chief Minister DK Shivakumar and Kiran Mazumdar-Shaw over the crumbling infrastructure in Bengaluru.

title: 'Will Write A Book': Ex-French President Sarkozy 'Not Afraid' Of Jail Term
content: Former French president Nicolas Sarkozy, set to start a five-year prison sentence on Tuesday after being convicted of attempting to raise campaign funds from Libya in 2007, said he is not afraid of going to jail, La Tribune Dimanche reported.

title: Mona Lisa Theft To Nazi Loots: Biggest Heists At The Louvre Museum
content: The world-famous Louvre Museum in Paris was closed on Sunday following a robbery, France's Culture Minister Rachida Dati confirmed. Authorities have not yet disclosed details about what was stolen or how the robbery occurred.

title: Jeffrey Epstein's Survivor Was Raped By "Well-Known Prime Minister": Memoir
content: According to the memoir, Virginia Giuffre met the "Prime Minister" on Epstein's private island in the US Virgin Islands in 2002, when she was 18.

title: Missing Deaf-Mute Hindu Minor Girl Surfaces In Pak, Married To Older Man
content: A 15-year-old Hindu girl, born deaf and mute, who was missing for over a week, has surfaced before the media in Pakistan's Sindh province, holding a certificate of conversion to Islam after allegedly marrying a much older Muslim man.

title: Mid-air emergency: Flight from Jakarta to Medina diverted to Kerala
content: The TOI News Desk comprises a dedicated and tireless team of journalists who operate around the clock to deliver the most current and comprehensive news and updates to the readers of The Times of India worldwide. With an unwavering commitment to excellence in journalism, our team is at the forefront of gathering, verifying, and presenting breaking news, in-depth analysis, and insightful reports on a wide range of topics. The TOI News Desk is your trusted source for staying informed and connected to the ever-evolving global landscape, ensuring that our readers are equipped with the latest developments that matter most." title: Tamil Nadu government fully prepared to face northeast monsoon, says Stalin
content: After chairing a review meeting at the State Emergency Operations Centre in Chennai, the Chief Minister says all precautionary measures have been taken and that there is no danger or risk at present

title: Assam govt. shielding accused in Zubeen Garg death case: Congress
content: Gaurav Gogoi alleges SIT formed to protect those close to the Chief Minister; tributes held across Assam a month after singer‚Äôs passing

title: Digital University Kerala scientists develop AI system to detect antenna types without physical testing
content: Innovation could lead to self-diagnosing communication modules in satellites, drones and Internet of Things devices to enable real-time performance monitoring and fault detection

title: Eight private industrial parks functional in Kerala, says Rajeeve
content: Industries Minister says until now around ‚Çπ1,750 crore has been invested across these parks. The govt. has set aside 448 acres of land for industrial use across the 37 parks approved by the department

title: Jharkhand bypoll: Ghatsila to witness three-cornered contest with JLKM fielding candidate
content: The JLKM was said to have played a spoilsport for national alliances, including the NDA in several seats, particularly in Bokaro, Ramgarh, Gomia, Dhanbad and Giridih belt of the state, in the 2024 Assembly polls

title: Massive blaze at firecracker market in U.P.‚Äôs Fatehpur guts 65 shops, crackers worth crores destroyed
content: According to eyewitnesses, the fire broke out around 12.30 p.m. at one of the cracker stalls, allegedly sparked by a short-circuit

title: Organise CII Partnership Summit in Vizag on the lines of WEF meet in Davos, A.P. CM Chandrababu Naidu tells officials
content: The Port City is poised to emerge as a global destination with the establishment of the Google AI data centre, and no opportunity should go waste, he insists

title: SC terms pendency of over 8.82 lakh execution petitions ‚Äúalarming‚Äù
content: Bench of Justices Pardiwala and Mithal calls situation ‚Äúhighly disappointing‚Äù; directs High Courts to ensure timely disposal of execution pleas

title: Andhra Pradesh CM Chandrababu Naidu announces release of ‚Çπ1,500 crore pending incentives to industries on Deepavali eve
content: It is part of the government‚Äôs endeavour to make Andhra Pradesh the prime destination for industries and businesses, says an official release; AP Chambers says it offers a big relief to the MSMEs

title: Orthodox Church voices dissent over KPCC reshuffle, feels its members were overlooked
content: Two metropolitans of the Kottayam-headquartered Church criticise the omission of Abin Varkey and Chandy Oommen from key positions. Orthodox Church is also concerned about the growing influence of the Catholic community in the party

title: DKS counters critics during ‚ÄòWalk with Bengaluru‚Äô campaign; they have forgotten the roots, he says
content: Among the key issues raised by residents were sewage treatment concerns, flooding, incomplete development projects, including the long-delayed Ejipura Flyover, and a lack of regular bus services

title: Apologise to Nagas for past mistakes, Manipur group tells NSCN‚Äôs Thuingaleng Muivah
content: The Zeliangrong United Front accused the NSCN leader of ordering arson in villages, taxation, and the killings of many prominent leaders

title: Low-pressure area likely to form in the Bay on October 21, says weatherman
content: Under its influence, there may be some rainfall activity at isolated places during Deepavali, says the Cyclone Warning Centre in Visakhapatnam

title: Smart mobility project BUSZ set to transform public transport in Kozhikode

title: LaMelo playing 70+ games and other bold predictions for 2025-26

content: Sunday's NFL Week 7 action kicked off early in London with the  Los Angeles Rams  facing the  Jacksonville Jaguars  at a rainy Wembley Stadium in the league's fourth straight international game. Follow along here for real-time highlights, analysis and key moments from Sunday's games:

title: Projecting the CFP top 12 after Week 8: Big move for Bama

title: Best of Week 8: The SEC runs through Alabama, Georgia and ... Vanderbilt?!

title: Postecoglou's coaching stint at Forest was short, but not Premier League's shortest
content: ange Postecoglou has been sacked by Nottingham Forest after just 39 days and five premier league matches in charge . he took over on september 9, making him the 10th permanent manager to last less than 100 days as a permanent manager during the era . sportsmail look at the managers who failed to make a positive impact in the early days of their reign .
